scenes.name: Nick's Reflections and Advice from His Father
scenes.summary: Nick Carraway contemplates the life lessons imparted by his father, setting the tone for his reflective and nonjudgmental narrative perspective.
scenes.firstLine: In my younger and more vulnerable years my father gave me some advice that I've been turning over in my mind ever since.
scenes.lastLine: And, after boasting this way of my tolerance, I come to the admission that it has a limit.

characters.name: Nick
characters.quote: I've been turning over in my mind ever since.

scenes.name: Nick's Arrival in West Egg
scenes.summary: Nick moves to West Egg, expressing optimism yet feeling a sense of isolation in his new surroundings.
scenes.firstLine: My family have been prominent, well-to-do people in this Middle Western city for three generations.
scenes.lastLine: And so with the sunshine and the great bursts of leaves growing on the trees, just as things grow in fast movies, I had that familiar conviction that life was beginning over again with the summer.

characters.name: Nick
characters.quote: It was lonely for a day or so until one morning some man, more recently arrived than I, stopped me on the road.

scenes.name: Dinner at the Buchanans
scenes.summary: An awkward dinner at the Buchanans' introduces Nick to Daisy's superficial happiness and Tom's domineering arrogance, foreshadowing conflicts to come.
scenes.firstLine: Across the courtesy bay the white palaces of fashionable East Egg glittered along the water, and the history of the summer really begins on the evening I drove over there to have dinner with the Tom Buchanans.
scenes.lastLine: I'm p-paralysed with happiness.

characters.name: Nick
characters.quote: I was a guide, a pathfinder, an original settler.

characters.name: Daisy
characters.quote: I'm p-paralysed with happiness.

characters.name: Tom Buchanan
characters.quote: Two shining arrogant eyes had established dominance over his face.

characters.name: Jordan Baker
characters.quote: Absolutely! I haven't heard a word.

scenes.name: The Revelation of Tom's Affair
scenes.summary: A tense moment reveals Tom Buchanan's affair, illustrating the underlying conflicts and the moral ambiguity of the characters involved.
scenes.firstLine: The telephone rang inside, startlingly, and as Daisy shook her head decisively at Tom the subject of the stables, in fact all subjects, vanished into air.
scenes.lastLine: Tom's got some woman in New York.

characters.name: Tom Buchanan
characters.quote: What you doing, Nick?

characters.name: Daisy
characters.quote: You did it, Tom, she said accusingly. I know you didn't mean to, but you did do it.

characters.name: Nick
characters.quote: I couldn't guess what Daisy and Tom were thinking, but I doubt if even Miss Baker, who seemed to have mastered a certain hardy scepticism, was able utterly to put this fifth guest's shrill metallic urgency out of mind.

scenes.name: Encounter with Myrtle Wilson
scenes.summary: Tom Buchanan displays his dominance and possessiveness during an encounter with his mistress, Myrtle Wilson, in the Valley of Ashes.
scenes.firstLine: We were on our way to New York to meet Tom's woman.
scenes.lastLine: I want to get one of those dogs, she said earnestly.

characters.name: Tom Buchanan
characters.quote: We're getting off, he insisted. I want you to meet my girl.

characters.name: Myrtle Wilson
characters.quote: I want to get one of those dogs, she said earnestly.

characters.name: George Wilson
characters.quote: I can't complain, answered Wilson unconvincingly.

scenes.name: The Party in the Apartment
scenes.summary: A chaotic party in Myrtle's New York apartment ends violently, highlighting the destructive nature of Tom and Myrtle's relationship.
scenes.firstLine: The apartment was on the top floor—a small living-room, a small dining-room, a small bedroom, and a bath.
scenes.lastLine: Making a short deft movement, Tom Buchanan broke her nose with his open hand.

characters.name: Nick
characters.quote: I was within and without, simultaneously enchanted and repelled by the inexhaustible variety of life.

characters.name: Myrtle Wilson
characters.quote: With the influence of the dress her personality had also undergone a change.

characters.name: Tom Buchanan
characters.quote: Daisy! Daisy! Daisy! shouted Mrs. Wilson. I'll say it whenever I want to! Daisy! Dai— Making a short deft movement, Tom Buchanan broke her nose with his open hand.

scenes.name: Gatsby's Lavish Party
scenes.summary: Nick attends one of Gatsby's extravagant parties, capturing the opulence and enigmatic aura of his neighbor's lifestyle.
scenes.firstLine: There was music from my neighbour's house through the summer nights.
scenes.lastLine: I've never met so many celebrities. I liked that man—what was his name?—with the sort of blue nose.

characters.name: Gatsby
characters.quote: The honour would be entirely Gatsby's, it said, if I would attend his 'little party' that night.

characters.name: Nick
characters.quote: I was one of the few guests who had actually been invited.

characters.name: Daisy
characters.emotion: Superficial fascination combined with a deeper discontent
characters.quote: I've never met so many celebrities. I liked that man—what was his name?—with the sort of blue nose.

characters.name: Jordan Baker
characters.quote: Hello! I roared, advancing toward her. My voice seemed unnaturally loud across the garden.

scenes.name: Rumors About Gatsby
scenes.summary: Gatsby's party guests speculate wildly about their host's mysterious past, demonstrating the rampant gossip and intrigue surrounding Gatsby.
scenes.firstLine: I had taken two finger-bowls of champagne, and the scene had changed before my eyes into something significant, elemental, and profound.
scenes.lastLine: 'Somebody told me they thought he killed a man once.'

characters.name: Party Guests
characters.quote: 'Somebody told me they thought he killed a man once.'

characters.name: Nick
characters.quote: I hadn't heard it and I doubted if there was any foundation for it.

scenes.name: Nick's Encounter with Gatsby
scenes.summary: Nick meets Gatsby, finding him to be gracious and charming, yet surrounded by an air of mystery.
scenes.firstLine: I was alone again in the unquiet darkness.
scenes.lastLine: He smiled understandingly—much more than understandingly.

characters.name: Gatsby
characters.quote: He smiled understandingly—much more than understandingly.

characters.name: Nick
characters.quote: It was one of those rare smiles with a quality of eternal reassurance in it.

characters.name: Jordan Baker
characters.quote: I've just heard the most amazing thing... and here I am tantalizing you.

scenes.name: After the Party
scenes.summary: Gatsby shares moments of pride and aloofness with Nick after the party, revealing his complex character.
scenes.firstLine: Reading over what I have written so far, I see I have given the impression that the events of three nights several weeks apart were all that absorbed me.
scenes.lastLine: Somehow it seemed a great deal of effort to begin an intrusion into Gatsby's life.

characters.name: Gatsby
characters.quote: He was looking at an elegant young rough-neck, a year or two over thirty.

characters.name: Nick
characters.quote: Somehow it seemed a great deal of effort to begin an intrusion into Gatsby's life.

scenes.name: A Drive with Gatsby
scenes.summary: Gatsby attempts to impress Nick with his luxurious car and hints at his affluent but mysterious lifestyle during a drive together.
scenes.firstLine: When I came home to West Egg that night I was afraid for a moment that my house was on fire.
scenes.lastLine: 'It's pretty, isn't it, old sport?'

characters.name: Gatsby
characters.quote: 'It's pretty, isn't it, old sport?'

characters.name: Nick
characters.quote: He saw me looking with admiration at his car.

scenes.name: Lunch in New York
scenes.summary: Gatsby introduces Nick to his enigmatic world during a lunch in New York, filled with hints of mystery and intrigue.
scenes.firstLine: 'We're going to lunch,' said Gatsby.
scenes.lastLine: 'I thought we'd be here at the restaurant.'

characters.name: Gatsby
characters.quote: 'We're going to lunch,' said Gatsby.

characters.name: Nick
characters.quote: 'I thought we'd be here at the restaurant.'

scenes.name: Revelation of Gatsby's Past
scenes.summary: Gatsby's attempts to legitimize his past to Nick in his mansion, amidst doubts and curiosities.
scenes.firstLine: He smiled understandingly—much more than understandingly. It was one of those rare smiles with a quality of eternal reassurance in it.
scenes.lastLine: But I didn't call to him, for he gave a sudden intimation that he was content to be alone—he stretched out his arms toward the dark water in a curious way, and, far as I was from him, I could have sworn he was trembling.

characters.name: Gatsby
characters.quote: 'Look here, this is a bona fide piece of printed matter.'

characters.name: Owl Eyes
characters.quote: 'This fella's a regular Belasco. It's a triumph. What thoroughness! What realism!'

characters.name: Nick
characters.quote: I was amazed to find that I had no idea at all.

scenes.name: The Party Continues
scenes.summary: The lively atmosphere at Gatsby's party continues, with Gatsby playing the gracious host amidst his quest for Daisy's affection.
scenes.firstLine: Reading over what I have written so far, I see I have given the impression that the events of three nights several weeks apart were all that absorbed me.
scenes.lastLine: One of the taxi drivers in the village never took a fare past the entrance gate without stopping for a minute and pointing inside; perhaps it was he who drove Daisy and Gatsby over to East Egg the night of the accident, and perhaps he had made a story about it all his own.

characters.name: Gatsby
characters.quote: Gatsby, his hands still in his pockets, was reclining against the mantelpiece in a strained counterfeit of perfect ease, even of boredom.

characters.name: Party Guests
characters.quote: Voices were singing and the sound of a vast tambourine shuttered through the air.

characters.name: Nick
characters.quote: I found myself on Gatsby's side, and alone.

scenes.name: Aftermath of the Party
scenes.summary: In the quiet aftermath of the party, Gatsby's solitary reflection reveals his deep-seated loneliness and unfulfilled desires.
scenes.firstLine: I found myself on Gatsby's side, and alone.
scenes.lastLine: He was clutching at some last hope and I couldn't bear to shake him free.

characters.name: Gatsby
characters.quote: Gatsby was standing alone on the marble steps, looking over the party's remnants.

characters.name: Nick
characters.quote: I couldn't help but wonder what Gatsby was thinking as he stood there alone.

scenes.name: Gatsby Opens Up to Nick
scenes.summary: During a drive, Gatsby confides in Nick, revealing more about his past and vulnerabilities in a bid for understanding.
scenes.firstLine: It was when curiosity about Gatsby was at its highest that the lights in his house failed to go on one Saturday night.
scenes.lastLine: There must have been moments even that afternoon when Daisy tumbled short of his dreams—not through her own fault but because of the colossal vitality of his illusion.

characters.name: Gatsby
characters.quote: He spoke earnestly and I could see a hint of vulnerability in his eyes.

characters.name: Nick
characters.quote: His story was unlike anything I'd expected, and I found myself drawn in, wanting to understand more.

scenes.name: The Plaza Hotel Confrontation
scenes.summary: A heated confrontation at the Plaza Hotel brings tensions to a head, revealing the deep-seated conflicts among the characters.
scenes.firstLine: The next day was broiling, almost the last, certainly the warmest, of the summer.
scenes.lastLine: So we drove on toward death through the cooling twilight.

characters.name: Gatsby
characters.quote: His voice was firm and filled with tension as he demanded Tom to acknowledge his relationship with Daisy.

characters.name: Tom Buchanan
characters.quote: Tom's face reddened with anger as he denied Gatsby's accusations and attacked his character.

characters.name: Daisy
characters.quote: She looked from Tom to Gatsby, and then back at Tom again, her expression filled with distress and indecision.

characters.name: Nick
characters.quote: I felt caught in the middle of a deeply personal conflict, unsure of my place or how to alleviate the tension.

scenes.name: The Tragic Climax
scenes.summary: A fatal accident in the Valley of Ashes sets off a chain of events that culminate in tragedy, underscoring the novel's themes of loss and consequence.
scenes.firstLine: The next day was broiling, almost the last, certainly the warmest, of the summer.
scenes.lastLine: They were careless people, Tom and Daisy—they smashed up things and creatures and then retreated back into their money or their vast carelessness, or whatever it was that kept them together, and let other people clean up the mess they had made.

characters.name: George Wilson
characters.quote: Wilson's grief was palpable, his eyes hollow with the shock of his loss.

characters.name: Nick
characters.quote: The gravity of the situation was overwhelming, leaving me feeling helpless and deeply saddened.

characters.name: Gatsby
characters.quote: Despite not being his fault, Gatsby's concern was for Daisy's involvement and the potential consequences for her.

scenes.name: The Aftermath and Gatsby's Resolve
scenes.summary: Gatsby's tragic end in his pool reflects the ultimate failure of his dreams and the hollowness of his pursuit of Daisy.
scenes.firstLine: I couldn't sleep all night; a fog-horn was groaning incessantly on the Sound, and I tossed half-sick between grotesque reality and savage, frightening dreams.
scenes.lastLine: He must have felt that he had lost the old warm world, paid a high price for living too long with a single dream.

characters.name: Nick
characters.quote: Seeing Gatsby's lifeless body, I couldn't help but reflect on the hollowness of his pursuit and the price he paid.

characters.name: Gatsby
characters.quote: Even to the end, Gatsby believed in the green light, the orgastic future that year by year recedes before us.

scenes.name: Nick's Lament and Farewell to Gatsby
scenes.summary: Gatsby's poorly attended funeral leads Nick to lament the ephemeral nature of Gatsby's life and relationships.
scenes.firstLine: After two years I remember the rest of that day, and that night and the next day, only as an endless drill of police and photographers and newspaper men in and out of Gatsby's front door.
scenes.lastLine: They were careless people, Tom and Daisy—they smashed up things and creatures and then retreated back into their money or their vast carelessness, or whatever it was that kept them together, and let other people clean up the mess they had made.

characters.name: Nick
characters.quote: It was an empty, solemn event, reflecting the transient nature of Gatsby's relationships and the superficiality of the world he had sought to belong to.

characters.name: Owl Eyes
characters.quote: 'The poor son-of-a-bitch,' he muttered. There was genuine sorrow in his voice, a rare moment of humanity in the midst of widespread indifference.

characters.name: Jordan Baker
characters.quote: I thought you were rather an honest, straightforward person. I thought it was your secret pride.

scenes.name: Nick's Reflection and Departure
scenes.summary: Disillusioned with the East, Nick decides to return to the Midwest, reflecting on the lessons learned from his experiences.
scenes.firstLine: One of my most vivid memories is of coming back West from prep school and later from college at Christmas time.
scenes.lastLine: So we beat on, boats against the current, borne back ceaselessly into the past.

characters.name: Nick
characters.quote: I saw the East as a grotesque, distorted place, far removed from the ideals I once held. It was time to go home.

locations.name: Nick's Childhood Home
locations.quote: One of my most vivid memories is of coming back West from prep school and later from college at Christmas time. [...] That's my Middle West—not the wheat or the prairies or the lost Swede towns, but the thrilling returning trains of my youth, and the street lamps and sleigh bells in the frosty dark and the shadows of holly wreaths thrown by lighted windows on the snow. I am part of that, a little solemn with the feel of those long winters, a little complacent from growing up in the Carraway house in a city where dwellings are still called through decades by a family's name.

locations.name: West Egg - Nick's Home
locations.quote: My house was at the very tip of the egg, only fifty yards from the Sound, and squeezed between two huge places that rented for twelve or fifteen thousand a season. [...] My own house was an eyesore, but it was a small eyesore, and it had been overlooked, so I had a view of the water, a partial view of my neighbour's lawn, and the consoling proximity of millionaires—all for eighty dollars a month.

locations.name: East Egg
locations.quote: Their house was even more elaborate than I expected, a cheerful red-and-white Georgian Colonial mansion, overlooking the bay. The lawn started at the beach and ran towards the front door for a quarter of a mile, jumping over sundials and brick walks and burning gardens—finally when it reached the house drifting up the side in bright vines as though from the momentum of its run.

locations.name: Valley of Ashes
locations.quote: This is a valley of ashes—a fantastic farm where ashes grow like wheat into ridges and hills and grotesque gardens; where ashes take the forms of houses and chimneys and rising smoke and, finally, with a transcendent effort, of ash-grey men, who move dimly and already crumbling through the powdery air.

locations.name: New York
locations.quote: The apartment was on the top floor—a small living-room, a small dining-room, a small bedroom, and a bath. The living-room was crowded to the doors with a set of tapestried furniture entirely too large for it, so that to move about was to stumble continually over scenes of ladies swinging in the gardens of Versailles. The only picture was an over-enlarged photograph, apparently a hen sitting on a blurred rock. Looked at from a distance, however, the hen resolved itself into a bonnet, and the countenance of a stout old lady beamed down into the room. Several old copies of Town Tattle lay on the table together with a copy of Simon Called Peter, and some of the small scandal magazines of Broadway.

locations.name: West Egg - Gatsby's Mansion
locations.quote: The one on my right was a colossal affair by any standard—it was a factual imitation of some Hôtel de Ville in Normandy, with a tower on one side, spanking new under a thin beard of raw ivy, and a marble swimming pool, and more than forty acres of lawn and garden. It was Gatsby's mansion.

characters.quote: Everyone suspects himself of at least one of the cardinal virtues, and this is mine: I am one of the few honest people that I have ever known.
characters.explanation: A shade of green, symbolizing his role as an observer and his envy or aspirations, yet with an honest and fresh perspective.

characters.quote: He smiled understandingly—much more than understandingly. It was one of those rare smiles with a quality of eternal reassurance in it.
characters.explanation: A vibrant, rich blue, reflecting his deep desires and the melancholy hidden behind his lavish lifestyle.

characters.quote: Two shining arrogant eyes had established dominance over his face.
characters.explanation: A dominant, bold red, capturing his aggressive nature and forceful presence.

characters.quote: Daisy and Jordan lay upon an enormous couch, like silver idols weighing down their own white dresses against the singing breeze of the fans.
characters.explanation: A soft, ethereal gold, suggesting her allure and the unattainable, golden girl persona.

characters.quote: 'I married him because I thought he was a gentleman,' she said finally. 'I thought he knew something about breeding, but he wasn't fit to lick my shoe... The only crazy I was was when I married him. I knew right away I made a mistake.'
characters.explanation: A brighter, contrasting magenta, indicating her vibrant but tragic ambition to climb the social ladder.

characters.quote: He was a blond, spiritless man, anaemic, and faintly handsome. When he saw us a damp gleam of hope sprang into his light blue eyes.
characters.explanation: A subdued, greyish lavender, symbolizing his faded hope and the overshadowed life he leads.

characters.quote: I believe that on the first night I went to Gatsby's house I was one of the few guests who had actually been invited. People were not invited—they went there.
characters.explanation: A lively, festive orange, representing the carefree revelry and the superficial brightness of Gatsby's parties.

characters.quote: I looked around. It was the man with owl-eyed glasses whom I had found marvelling over Gatsby's books in the library one night three months before... 'The poor son-of-a-bitch,' he said.
characters.explanation: An insightful teal, hinting at his perceptive observations and the somewhat mysterious aura.

characters.quote: For a while I lost sight of Jordan Baker, and then in midsummer I found her again. At first I was flattered to go places with her, because she was a golf champion, and everyone knew her name. Then it was something more. I wasn't actually in love, but I felt a sort of tender curiosity.
characters.explanation: A cool, sleek silver, mirroring her sophistication, athletic prowess, and the modern woman she represents.
